data.title: Acacoyagua, Chiapas, Mexico
data.text:
Acacoyagua, also known as Acacoyahua, is a municipality in the Mexican state of Chiapas, located at latitude 15.3500000 and longitude -92.6500000. It has a tropical climate, with an average temperature of 27 degrees Celsius and an annual rainfall of 2,000 mm. The municipality's history dates back to the pre-Hispanic period, when it was inhabited by the Zoque people. In the 16th century, it was conquered by the Spanish and became part of the province of Chiapas. Acacoyagua's heritage is rich in indigenous traditions and customs, including the celebration of the Day of the Dead and the traditional dance of the Parachicos.
